TopicTitle: Coool... So what should I do next?

Articles.Content:
Having discovered KSP through the auspices of XKCD, I immediately became obsessed with the game (as is my wont). Many Kerbals have died, and many more became permanently space-sick, but we finally managed to land one Jebediah Kerman on the Mun, AND return him safely to Kerbin. Hooray! Much rejoicing!

So my question is: What Next? What is a good next goal for a rank amateur possessed of more enthusiasm than physics knowledge or common sense (actually kind of like a tall, pink Kerbal himself)? Should I try an interplanetary trip? Docking in orbit? Lose Jebediah and send out a rescue craft?

Thanks,

L

One of the hardest things to do in KSP is to rendezvous and dock with a ship in orbit, you can watch scott manly's tutorial, and if you find it too hard then there is a tutorial in the tutorials section of the main menu.

Good luck!

I really recommend the pain of career mode. It will constantly make you do things you aren't sure you can manage and you will learn a LOT.

If docking is an issue, you could always watch me mutter about it here

Hello @Waseemq1235, and welcome to the forum!

The post you're responding to was put up about 2 and half years ago.  I'm not sure whether that poster is still active on the forum.  I don't recall seeing the name before.

Anyway, glad to have you aboard.

Happy landings!

Edited February 25, 2016 by Starhawk

3 hours ago, Aperture Science said:

Welcome to the forums!

I never knew that the forums would treat me like this.

Thank you!

I never really enjoyed career mode that much so I set out to teach myself how to do things in IVA view exclusively. I really enjoyed the experience.  Having the proper command capsules was critical. I'm a big fan of Alexustas' ALCOR & mark 2.
i am wondering too what sould i do after i am doing registration...

1 hour ago, shakira26 said:

i am wondering too what sould i do after i am doing registration...

First, you should read the Community Guidelines and please take a look at the Good Conduct Guide.

Now that you are a member, you can post your questions, if you have any, in the Gameplay Questions section or write about your missions and link pictures you've uploaded to a photo-sharing website in the Mission Reports subsection.

You can get involved in any discussion which interests you.

Happy landings!
